description: Unique internal identifier for the task status record; primary key for this table.
Business-facing identifier or name of the task status used in user interfaces and references; typically unique.
Longer explanation of the task status to clarify when and how it should be used.
Flag indicating this status should be assigned by default to new tasks; 1=yes, 0=no.
Flag to hide this status from lookup or pick lists to prevent selection; 1=hidden, 0=visible.
Flag to exclude this status from reports and visualizations; 1=exclude, 0=include.
Soft-delete indicator marking the status as inactive or retired while preserving historical references; 1=inactive, 0=active.
Free-text notes or administrative comments about the status value for context or policy guidance.
System-maintained timestamp when this record was last changed, regardless of who made the change.
Legacy timestamp of last modification recorded by the application; likely redundant with other audit fields; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the user account that originally created this record.
Timestamp when this record was originally created by a user.
Identifier of the user account that last modified this record.
Timestamp when a user last modified this record; may overlap with system last_modified.
